intro: Turpinia jimenezii, commonly known as the Mexican mastic tree, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Sapotaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, fragrant white flowers. The tree produces a resinous sap that has been historically used for various purposes, including medicinal and industrial applications. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
